1.brief: properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan

2.brief: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to drive forth (a person, an animal or chariot), i.e. lead, carry away; reflexively, to proceed (i.e. impel or guide oneself); also (from the panting induced by effort), to sigh
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)

3.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

4.brief: to fail; by implication to wear out, decay (causatively, consume, spend)
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
skin (as naked); by implication, hide, leather
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame

5.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to strike with more or less violence (beat, fell, corrode); by implication (of attack) to knock together, i.e. surround or circulate
a poisonous plant, probably the poppy (from its conspicuous head); generally poison (even of serpents)

6.brief: properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

7.brief: in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)
copper, hence, something made of that metal, i.e. coin, a fetter; figuratively, base (as compared with gold or silver)

8.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly
properly, to be free; but used only causatively and reflexively, to halloo (for help, i.e. freedom from some trouble)
to stop up; by implication, to repair; figuratively, to keep secret
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn

9.brief: a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

10.brief: he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
properly, a concealer, i.e. a covert

11.brief: a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

12.brief: to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
to station, in various applications (literally or figuratively)
a jail (as a guard-house); also an aim (as being closely watched)
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear

13.brief: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a kidney (as an essential organ); figuratively, the mind (as the interior self)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

14.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, instrumental music; by implication, a stringed instrument; by extension, a poem set to music; specifically, an epigram
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

to slake the thirst (occasionally of other appetites)
wormwood (regarded as poisonous, and therefore accursed)

16.brief: to crush; also (intransitively and figuratively) to dissolve
properly, something cutting; hence, gravel (as grit); an arrow
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
to tread down; figuratively, to humiliate

properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to forget; figuratively, to neglect; causatively, to remit, remove

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

18.brief: properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),

65.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a covering (in a bad sense), i.e. blindness or obduracy
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

66.brief: to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
